Package edu.cnm.deepdive.security

Class Diceware

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cnm.deepdive.security.Diceware

  • public class Diceware
extends Object
    The Diceware class implements a Diceware-based passphrase generator, using a word list provided in the constructor invocation. If a pseudo-random number generator is not set (using the setRng(Random) method), then an instance of SecureRandom is created and used for selecting words at random from the list.
    Version:
    0.9
    Author:
    Nicholas Bennett with Deep Dive Coding Java Cohort 3

    • Constructor Detail

      • Diceware

        public Diceware​()
        Initializes an instance of Diceware using a reference to a File object. If the File does not exist, of cannot be read, an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        file - file to read for word list.
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException - if file does not exist.
        IOException - if file can't be read.

      • Diceware

        public Diceware​(File file)
         throws FileNotFoundException,
                IOException
        Throws:
        FileNotFoundException
        IOException

      • Diceware

        public Diceware​(Collection<String> source)
        Initializes an instance of Diceware using a Collection as the source of words for the word list.
        Parameters:
        source - word list source.

      • Diceware

        public Diceware​(ResourceBundle bundle)
        Initializes an instance of Diceware using a ResourceBundle object as the source of words for the word list. (The property values from the ResourceBundle are taken as the words; the property names/keys are ignored.)
        Parameters:
        bundle - properties provided words (values) for word list.

    • Method Detail

      • getRng

        public Random getRng​()
              throws NoSuchAlgorithmException
        Initializes (if necessary) and returns the Random instance to be used for selecting words from the word list.
        Returns:
        pseudo-random number generator instance.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if lazy initialization is used, and default strong provider algorithm does not exist.

      • setRng

        public void setRng​(Random rng)
        Sets a reference to the Random instance to be used for selecting words from the word list.
        Parameters:
        rng - pseudo-random number generator instance.

      • generate

        public String[] generate​(int length,
                         boolean duplicatesAllowed)
                  throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                         Diceware.InsufficientPoolException,
                         IllegalArgumentException
        Generates and returns (in a String[]) a password of the specified length. The inclusion of duplicates is controlled by the duplicatesAllowed argument. If the specified length is greater than the number of words in the word list, and duplicates aren't allowed, then an infinite loop will result.
        Parameters:
        length - number of words to include in generated passphrase.
        duplicatesAllowed - true if duplicate words are allowed; false otherwise.
        Returns:
        words in generated passphrase.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algorithm for default strong source of randomness is not available.
        Diceware.InsufficientPoolException - if password length exceeds word list, and duplicates not allowed or word list has no words.
        IllegalArgumentException - if requested length is not positive.

      • generate

        public String[] generate​(int length)
                  throws NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                         Diceware.InsufficientPoolException,
                         IllegalArgumentException
        Generates and returns (in a String[]) a password of the specified length. This method simply invokes generate(length, true) – that is, it invokes generate(int, boolean), specifying that duplicates are allowed.
        Parameters:
        length - number of words to include in generated passphrase.
        Returns:
        words in generated passphrase.
        Throws:
        NoSuchAlgorithmException - if algorithm for default strong source of randomness is not available.
        Diceware.InsufficientPoolException - if word list has no words.
        IllegalArgumentException - if requested length is negative.
